conditions.name: ALT/AST Elevation (High)
conditions.description: Alanine or Aspartate aminotransferase elevation greater than 5 times the upper limit of normal.

conditions.name: ALT/AST Elevation (Moderate)
conditions.description: Alanine or Aspartate aminotransferase elevation greater than 3 and less than or equal to 5 times the upper limit of normal.

conditions.name: Neutropenia
conditions.description: Neutrophils decrease more than 30% from baseline and are below the reference range.
conditions.text: > 30% ↓ from baseline Neutrophils below reference range

conditions.name: Hy's Law Criteria
conditions.description: Bilirubin elevation accompanied by ALT elevation, indicative of liver injury.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN Accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN

conditions.name: Neurologic Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis.

conditions.name: Pregnancy
conditions.description: Participant becomes pregnant or is planning pregnancy.

conditions.name: Safety Review Committee Approval
conditions.description: SRC must review available safety data before dose titration.
conditions.text: Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

transitionRules.name: Dose Escalation to 30mg
transitionRules.text: participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day for a treatment period of approximately 28 days followed by titration up to 30 mg/day on Day 29.

transitionRules.name: Dose Escalation Hold
transitionRules.text: unless there are safety concerns that, in the opinion of the Investigator(s) and/or Alexion, may place participants at undue risk, in which case, participants may remain on the 15 mg/day dose for the duration of the study.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for High ALT/AST
transitionRules.text: If ALT/AST > 5 × ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Moderate ALT/AST
transitionRules.text: If ALT/AST > 3 × ULN and ≤ 5 × ULN, reduce dose to previous dose level or 15 mg QOD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Anemia
transitionRules.text: If Hemoglobin < 10 g/dL, reduce dose to previous dose level or 15 mg QOD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Thrombocytopenia
transitionRules.text: If Platelets < 100,000/mm3, reduce dose to previous dose level or 15 mg QOD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Neutropenia
transitionRules.text: If Neutrophils > 30% ↓ from baseline and below reference range, reduce dose to previous dose level or 15 mg QOD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Liver Injury
transitionRules.text: If Bilirubin > 2 × ULN Accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Safety
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if any of the following occur during the study: Serious hypersensitivity reaction; Severe uncontrolled infection; Use of disallowed medication; Pregnancy or planned pregnancy; or Alexion or the Investigator deems it is necessary for the participant.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities (SoA).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discontinuation
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant... may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Escalation Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision to escalate dose from 15mg to 30mg on Day 29 is contingent on a favorable safety review by the SRC of data collected through Day 23.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Ongoing Dose Modification Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Ongoing evaluation of safety parameters (liver function, hematology, neurologic/psychiatric status) can trigger dose modification or interruption at any time during the study.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Study Intervention Discontinuation Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision to discontinue a participant from the study intervention based on specific events such as pregnancy, severe infection, or hypersensitivity.
